alert.note: Alert for Marion; Washington (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 29 at 8:33PM EDT until July 30 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of NORTH CENTRAL and SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following counties, in NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Washington KY. In SOUTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Marion. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 833 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lebanon, Springfield, Jimtown, Simstown, Briartown, Cisselville, Rineltown, Poplar Corner, Bearwallow and Burkes Spring. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
